alert.note: Alert for Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:09PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Winona, La Crosse, southwestern Jackson, southwestern Juneau, northern Vernon, Monroe and south central Trempealeau Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 508 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Black River Falls to 6 miles north of Cataract to 6 miles southeast of North Bend to near Winona. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Black River Falls and Cataract around 515 PM CDT. Bangor around 520 PM CDT. Sparta, Dakota, Brice Prairie and Fort Mc Coy around 525 PM CDT. La Crosse, Tomah, La Crescent, Onalaska, Holmen, La Crosse Airport and French Island around 535 PM CDT. People attending the La Crosse County Fairgrounds should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
